title: news.com.au — Australia’s #1 news site
text: New South Wales Treasurer Dominic Perrottet projects the economy will return to trend next year, amid calls for both the NSW and federal governments to inject more stimulus into the economy. “We’re obviously focused, particularly at a state level, on the supply side and making sure we cut red tape and continue to build infrastructure to drive economic growth at our end”. “If you look at the IMF and The World Bank they’re also saying that the most important thing is building more infrastructure, and we’ve got a significant pipeline of projects - $90 billion over the next four years – and that’s adding half a percentage point to our economic growth each year,” Mr Perrottet told Sky News. Image: News Corp Australia
